title: Australia stocks higher at close of trade; S&P/ASX 200 up 0.21%
text:
© Reuters. Australia stocks higher at close of trade; S&P/ASX 200 up 0.21%

Investing.com – Australia stocks were higher after the close on Friday, as gains in the , and sectors led shares higher.

At the close in Sydney, the added 0.21% to hit a new 1-month high.

The best performers of the session on the were NIB Holdings (ASX: ), which rose 4.46% or 0.320 points to trade at 7.490 at the close. Meanwhile, Qantas Airways Ltd (ASX: ) added 2.24% or 0.14 points to end at 6.40 and Ausdrill Ltd (ASX: ) was up 2.22% or 0.050 points to 2.300 in late trade.

The worst performers of the session were Pro Medicus Ltd (ASX: ), which fell 5.66% or 1.680 points to trade at 28.000 at the close. Appen Ltd (ASX: ) declined 4.00% or 0.910 points to end at 21.840 and G8 Education Ltd (ASX: ) was down 3.91% or 0.100 points to 2.460.

Rising stocks outnumbered declining ones on the Sydney Stock Exchange by 595 to 594 and 366 ended unchanged.

Shares in Qantas Airways Ltd (ASX: ) rose to 52-week highs; rising 2.24% or 0.14 to 6.40. Shares in Ausdrill Ltd (ASX: ) rose to 52-week highs; up 2.22% or 0.050 to 2.300.

The , which measures the implied volatility of S&P/ASX 200 options, was down 4.52% to 12.357 a new 1-month low.

Gold Futures for December delivery was up 0.25% or 3.75 to $1511.15 a troy ounce. Elsewhere in commodities trading, Crude oil for delivery in October fell 0.22% or 0.12 to hit $54.97 a barrel, while the November Brent oil contract fell 0.30% or 0.18 to trade at $60.20 a barrel.

AUD/USD was up 0.07% to 0.6871, while AUD/JPY rose 0.00% to 74.22.

The US Dollar Index Futures was down 0.11% at 98.197.
description: Australia stocks higher at close of trade; S&P/ASX 200 up 0.21%
